title: Biostats uOttawa
text: This site regroup the different resources developed for the biostatistic courses at the university of Ottawa by Julien Martin

title: Biostats uOttawa
text:
Applied biostatistics with R (BIO 4X58)










Offered to both undergraduate and graduate students in english and french
Prerequisite:

an introduction class to statisticis is good to have
No (or limited) knowledge of R and no (or limited) knowledge of stats expected.

BIO4158 english (Course site / Course manual)
BIO4558 french (Course site / Course manual)

title: Biostats uOttawa
text:
Advanced biostatistics and open science (BIO 8940)










Bilingual course for graduate students
Prerequisite:

a functional knowledge of R (loading data, running basic linear models, and making plots)
a good understanding of linear models
essentially Bio8940 is a great next steps after completing Bio4x58.

Course site / Course manual

title: Biostats uOttawa
section: Statistics with R: On the R-way to hell
text:
Statistics with R: On the R-way to hell









This is an introduction to statistics and R book with a multilingual approach. The book is covering an introduction to the basic use of R (data loading, wrangling and plotting), as well as programming, use of github and R markdown /Quarto with R Studio and VS code. It then covers a lot of statistical subjects.
The book (still under development) is available in English and French. I will add more languages later this year hopefully with help of volunteers.

title: Biostats uOttawa
section: How to fit an animal model
text:
How to fit an animal model









The book is tutorial on how to fit an animal model using multiple R packages. This is essentially an updated and extended version of the tutorials from ‚ÄúAn ecologist guide to animal model‚Äù paper by Wilson et al. (2010).

title: Julien Martin
text:
Julien is an Associate Professor at the University of Ottawa and has been teaching (and learning) R for the last 15 years.
I created the websites using Quarto, R, revealjs, mermaid.js and graphViz. I developed the theme for the slides based on the xaringan blackboard theme.

Julien est Professeur agr√©g√© √† l‚ÄôUniversit√© d‚ÄôOttawa en biologie √©volutive et quantitative et il enseigne R (et l‚Äôapprend) depuis plus de 15 ans.
J‚Äôai cr√©√© le site internet en utilisant Quarto, R, revealjs, mermaid.js et graphViz. J‚Äôai d√©velopp√© le th√®me de mes pr√©sentations √† partir de du theme ‚Äúblackboard‚Äù pour xaringan.

title: Note on images
text:
All photos, images and screenshot were produced by Julien Martin. Figures produced as code output were generated using R with code provided aither in teh document or available on github.
Images were generated via NightCaf√© AI image generator (see image description and generating call below).

title: On the R-way to hell
text:
About slides  and notes 

Slides 
Slides in revealjs format (html). If you want then as a pdf (note you might loose some functionality or contents due to tabs and scroll sections):

Open the slides in your browser from a link on this page
Press e to get into the PDF export mode (?print-pdf should appear near the end of the url and white borders should appear)
Open the in-browser print dialog (CTRL/CMD+P).
Change the Destination setting to Save as PDF.
Change the Layout to Landscape.
Change the Margins to None.
Enable the Background graphics option (if you want it)
Click Save üéâ



Notes 
Content of the slides in html format as a self-contained downloadable file and including tabs and scroll sections.
More importantly, notes have the commenting and annotateing tools activated via https://hypothes.is/. If you create a free account , you can annotate and comment slides as well as share your annotations/comments with the public or via private or public groups.

section: Sur le chemin de l‚Äôenf-R (intro aux stats avec R)
text:
Sur le chemin de l‚Äôenf-R (intro aux stats avec R)









Il s‚Äôagit d‚Äôun livre d‚Äôintroduction aux statistiques et √† R avec une approche multilingue. Le livre couvre une introduction √† l‚Äôutilisation de base de R (chargement de donn√©es, manipulation et tra√ßage), ainsi que des statistiques simples, la programmation, l‚Äôutilisation de github et de R markdown /Quarto avec R Studio et VS code.
Le livre (encore en d√©veloppement) est disponible en anglais et fran√ßais. J‚Äôajouterai d‚Äôautres langues plus tard dans l‚Äôann√©e, avec l‚Äôaide de volontaires.

title: Biostats uOttawa
text:
Comment f-R un mod√®le animal









Le livre est un tutoriel sur comment faire un un mod√®le animal avec R en utilisant plusieurs paquets R. Le projet est bas√© sur les tutoriels fournis dans ‚ÄúAn ecologist guide to animal model‚Äù par Wilson et al.¬†(2010), mis √† jour et √©tendus.
